bwwExcerpt: Theresa Rebeck’s play about a hoarder is the slightest of comedies. Its plot is paltry. Its insights are pat. It promises more laughs than it delivers.  It even promises more junk than it delivers: Before the curtain rises, there’s a tantalizing pile-up of old papers and boxes resting on the lip of the stage. But “I Need That” does deliver Danny DeVito, and for some, that will be enough.

keyPhrases.quote: Its plot is paltry. Its insights are pat. It promises more laughs than it delivers.
does deliver Danny DeVito, and for some, that will be enough

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The review systematically criticizes the play's script, plot, and humor while offering only DeVito's presence as a qualified positive, suggesting most audiences should skip it.
